sections.why_your_lawn_needs_this:
Designed for varied soil conditions of Texas lawns
Sustains a lush Texas lawn from summer into fall with slow-release nutrient formulations
Offers the fastest greening for your grass while enhancing your lawn's resilience to stress
Eliminates fall weeds at the optimal time to reduce spring weed growth
sections.whats_included:
Dandelion Doom Herbicide Concentrate Refill: Targets and eradicates weeds down to the root, effective against dandelions, white clover, moss, and more. 5 oz. concentrate bottle. Treats up to 224 sq. ft.
Herbicide Pouch + Sprayer: Simplify weed control with our reusable, easy-fill gallon pouch and premium Powerhouse™ wand sprayer for effortless application.
Weed Warrior Herbicide Spot Treatment: Quick and easy spray for tackling both broadleaf and grassy weeds, as well as moss and algae. Organic-gardening approved and safe for hardscapes without staining! 32 oz. bottle. Treats up to 50 sq. ft. of weeds.
Iron Boost (20-0-1): Supercharge your lawn's green color and strength with our highest nitrogen and iron pouch, accelerated by Iron Citrate for faster greening and fortified with a blend of seaweed and potassium hydroxide for ultimate resilience. 42 fl. oz. pouch. Covers up to 5,000 sq. ft.
Texas Green (22-0-2): Sustain your Texas lawn's greenness into fall with our nutrient-packed liquid fertilizer, rich in slow-release nitrogen and potassium. 42 fl. oz. pouch. Covers up to 5,000 sq. ft.
Replacement Sprayer: Achieve the perfect nutrient-to-water ratio with our reusable hose end sprayer, custom-engineered for optimal lawn nourishment.
This kit is suitable for any Texas cool or warm-season grass type and residential lawn. Lawns larger than 5,000 sq. ft. may require two kits.
sections.faq:
In what order should I use the products?
Apply weed control in the lawn first. Assemble the Dandelion Doom herbicide starter kit (pouch, concentrate, wand), then spot treat small weeds and dense patches in the lawn. Fully drench leaves and allow it to dry completely for best results. Next, apply Weed Warrior. Spot treat remaining smaller weeds and patches of weeds with Weed Warrior across mulched areas, flower beds, near patios, along sidewalks. If using in lawn, use caution as it can harm desirable grasses too! Once weed control has dried, apply Iron Boost. Apply uniformly across the lawn and fully drench grass blades for best results. Let the fertilizer dry before doing anything else to the lawn. After 4-6 weeks, apply Texas Green using the same method. Continue to reapply Dandelion Doom every 3-4 weeks, and Weed Warrior every 2-3 weeks as needed until weeds are no longer actively growing.
How should I use the fertilizer pouches in my kit if my lawn is less than 5,000 sq. ft.?
Iron Boost and Texas Green cover up to 5,000 sq. ft. 500-1,000 sq. ft.: Apply 1/4 of a pouch (4 uses) 1,000-2,000 sq. ft.: Apply 1/2 of a pouch (2 uses) 2,000-5,000 sq. ft.: Apply a full pouch Wait one week between applications if not applying a full pouch.
What should I do if I apply the products in the wrong order?
If fertilizer is applied before applying weed control, that’s okay! Just be sure to apply Dandelion Doom and Weed Warrior as soon as possible after fertilizer. If you applied fertilizer in the opposite order, that's okay too. Just wait 4-6 weeks in between applications.
Can I use this kit alongside my Sunday lawn plan or other products?
Absolutely, this kit is designed to complement Sunday lawn and garden products. Allow dry time between liquid product applications for best results.
Are there any US states where the kit is not approved for use?
This kit is only approved for use in Texas.
